resources.string: Do you want to reset settings of widget %d to the default setting? This cannot undo.
Do you want to erase settings of widget %d? After erasing, this widget will follow the default setting. This cannot undo.
This widget follows the default setting.
Set the filtering mode, and select apps to be hidden or shown.
Show app icons which are never launched.
Never launched app icons are also appeared in the widget randomly.
Never launched app icons are disappeared in the widget.
Select apps to pin the first of the list.
Make the last icon of the widget the icon that enters the settings.
This setting is not affected by RTL layout.
Title bar is shown at the widget.
Title bar is hidden at the widget.
Last updated time is shown at the title of the widget.
Last updated time is hidden at the title of the widget.
Set the text that is displayed in the title area.
You can set padding values manually.
Padding values are adjust automatically by app icon size.
Select app icon shape or apply the icon pack.
Set horizontal/vertical gap between app icons separately
Horizontal gap size between app icons
Vertical gap size between app icons
Set app list horizontal/vertical padding separately
App list horizontal padding minimum size
App list vertical padding minimum size
If title bar is enabled, top padding is not applied.
About the minimum size of list padding

This setting is about the size empty space of Widget\'s edge area.\n Since this setting sets the \"minimum\" size of the space, so the actual area size could be wider than the value set here by other settings(app icon size, gap size between icons, etc.).
Gap size between icon and app name text
App name & text color in Dark mode
App usage time (Using Usage stats information)
Clear all apps launch counts that collected by Frequaw
All apps\' launch counts that Frequaw has collected will be cleared and reset. This can\'t be undo. Continue?
App launch history has been cleared.
Set the home launcher package name manually

If the activiated home launcher\'s package name is not the same as default, please enter the home launcher\'s package name that is currently activated. In most cases, you do not need to set this setting.
NOT RECOMMENDED:\nEnable this to not downsize the image of app icons in the widget. This option will increase the quality of icons but may cause the crash of the app, widget, and service.
Remove every widget setting and make all widgets follow the default settings.
This will erase all widget-specification settings and make all widgets follow the default settings. This cannot be undone. Do you want to proceed this?
To sort by app launch count, accessibility service permission is required to detect app launch.\nIf permission is granted, the widget will be updated immediately when returning to the home screen.
Disabling it could make Frequaw more stable.
To sort apps by usage time, usage stats permission is required to get apps usage information.
You can export the currently configured Frequaw settings and the app launch history that Frequaw has collected, or import the settings and history that have been exported.
Are you sure to import the setting? This will overwrite current settings and app launched counts.
Please choose the setting text file that was exported from Frequaw.
Fail to open the setting page. Please open it manually from the device\'s setting.
An unknown error has occurred while open the setting. Please open it manually from the device\'s setting.
Apps that checked below are not shown in the widget.
Only apps that checked below are shown in the widget.

The checked app is pinned to the first of the list, even if the launching count(or usage time) is not enough to appear in the list.\nIf 2 or more apps are checked, they will be sorted as well. \nIf checked apps are filtered so that they do not appear in the widget, they will not appear in the widget even they are checked here.
If an app is not listed, it means that the app has no launch or activated history.
Are you sure to clear %s launching history? This can\'t be undo.

Thanks to everyone who helped develop this app.

• Marcio de Andrade (Portuguese translation)
• Quinlan Vannatter (A lot of support)
• Reviewers
• And, thank you for using this app.

Frequaw never sends the collected app launching count data to the server or somewhere.\nThis data is only saved in your device.\nActually, we don\'t have any interest which apps are launched from your device.
There is some error while getting permission, so widgets are not able to be updated properly. Please check bottom message bers and fix them.
Use accessibility service to detect application launch or activation event. Shortcut is not needed.

Frequaw needs the Accessibility Services permission to detect app launching.
Frequaw uses accessibility service features only to detect foreground app changes. 

In the accessibility management screen(or in "Installed services" in some devices), find Frequaw and enable it. Shortcut is not necessary.

If you have already enabled it, please ignore this message.
If this message is appeared again even you enabled it, please turn off and on again the accessibility permission.
Frequaw accessibility service is not running.
Accessibility service should be turned on to save app launching events.
Battery optimization could affect to Frequaw.
Disabling it could make Frequaw working more stable.

Disable battery optimization for Frequaw could make Frequaw service more stable. 

This setting is not required for Frequaw, but if you have experience malfunction of Frequaw accessibility service, disable battery optimization might can help about this.
To disable it, open the battery optimization setting, select "All app" at the list, find Frequaw setting, and disable it.
The battery optimization setting activity couldn\'t be found on this device. Please disable it manually in the device\'s Setting app.
Please allow the Usage stats access permission to Frequaw.
Usage stats access permission is not granted to Frequaw.
Usage stats information is not available in this device.
Usage stats information is available on Android 10 or above.
To get apps\' usage information, the usage stats permission is required.\n\nPlease grant permission to Frequaw at Usage stats setting page.
Frequaw is an application that provides widgets with app icons arranged in the order they are frequently used.

Frequaw can sort apps by several methods. Please select one after the tutorial is over. You can change it anytime. Each method needs different permissions. Follow the instruction to grant permission that appear after the selecting page.

Just add the Frequaw widget to your home launcher and resize it to your liking. App icons are automatically added and sorted. At first, all the icons are randomly placed, but as you use your phone, they will be sorted in the order of the apps you use most often.
You can customize widgets at Frequaw setting screen. You can also choose apps to be blocked, or be shown.
If you see the yellow dot in the widget, there is something wrong while updating widget. Please click it and see the message at the bottom of the screen to fix it.
You can create multiple widgets with different settings. Add more widgets with your styles.
Now it\'s time to enjoy Frequaw!

Requires Accessibility service permission.
Frequaw uses accessibility service features only to detect foreground app changes. 

Frequaw directly receives the launch or activation event of apps, records the count of events, and uses this information to sort apps by launching count in the widget.

Requires Usage stats access permission.

Frequaw accesses to the app usage stats which is recorded at the device to get total usage times of apps, and use this information to sort apps by usage times in the widget.

App usage time is the time spent using the app from a month past until now.
Requires Accessibility service permission.\n\nSorting app by the recommendation that calculated comprehensively using app launched dates, launched time, and launched counts.

Requires Accessibility service permission.

Sorting app in order of executed(activated) most recently.
Use Accessibility service to gather information and sort.
The word "Activated" means that not only just launched, but also all of cases that the app becomes 'foreground' state, such as a part of the app is shown or switched again.

Widget updates are not real-time, so sometimes the recently launched app may not be the first.
Pro-mode features will be disabled. Ads will be hidden also.

Use Pro-mode features with ads.

Here are Pro-mode-only features. Some features which will be added later would be only available on the Pro-mode.
- Pin the selected app to the front of the widget
- Icons shape setting
- Icon packs support
This feature is available on the pro-mode.\nPro-mode is disabled currently. Would you like to activate the pro-mode?
Force all icons to be clipped into the selected shape.
